sense.name: A remark that calls attention to something or someone.
sense.examples: There was no reference to it in conversation. She made frequent reference to her promotion. The speaker made several references to his wife.

sense.name: An authoritative text or the corresponding citation.
sense.examples: The student's essay failed to list several important references. The article includes reference to similar studies. He contributed articles to a foundational reference on that topic. She makes reference to several additional works.

sense.name: An indicator that orients one generally.
sense.examples: It is used as a reference for comparing the energy involved. We should use that building as a point of reference.

sense.name: A formal recommendation by a former employer.
sense.examples: Most employers do not give references freely. I need a reference for my job application.

sense.name: (philosophy) the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression.
sense.examples: We must find the reference of the term. He argued that reference is consequence of conditioned reflexes. Terms require a role and a reference.

sense.name: The act of referring or consulting.
sense.examples: His reference to an encyclopedia produced an answer. Her reference to a dictionary improved her essay.

sense.name: (computer science) the code that identifies where a piece of information is stored.
sense.examples: The file contains the references for the data.
